fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing

Class SmoothingCVM

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.components.cvm.AbstractCVM
      • fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.SmoothingCVM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentVirtualMachineI

    public class SmoothingCVM
extends AbstractCVM
    The class SmoothingCVM deploys components of the smoothing example.

    Description

    Two sensor simulators push normally distributed random values through averaging filters and then to gauges that exchange their values to display the received value, its deviation from the last displayed value of the other gauge and the average deviation over time. If the two sensor simulators use the same mean and standard deviation, the average deviation between the two gauge should reduce as their windows (number of successive values used in the smoothing) augment.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 28 janv. 2014

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deploy()
      simply set the deploymentDone flag to true, so it should be called at the end of the user's own deploy method.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void shutdown()
      shut down the CVM, synchronising with the other JVM when distributed, i.e. all of the deployed components in the CVM are shut down; inspired from the Java Executor framework.
      void start()
      check if the deployment is completed, and start all of the deployed components.
